title: Asian-Style Cobb Salad with Sesame Grilled Chicken
summary: Asian-Style Cobb Salad with Sesame Grilled Chicken might be just the main course you are searching for. One portion of this dish contains approximately 31g of protein, 26g of fat, and a total of 416 calories. This recipe serves 4 and costs $2.77 per serving. 75 people found this recipe to be delicious and satisfying. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal diet. It can be enjoyed any time, but it is especially good for The Fourth Of July. It is a rather inexpensive recipe for fans of American food. Head to the store and pick up planters almonds, chicken breasts, carrots, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 57 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 97%. This score is outstanding. Similar recipes include Asian-Style Cobb Salad, Asian-Style Grilled Chicken Salad, and Asian-Style Grilled Chicken Salad With Cherry-Peanut Dressing.
instructions: Pour 1/4 cup dressing over chicken in shallow dish; turn to coat both sides of each breast.  Refrigerate 30 min. to marinate.                                            Heat greased grill to medium-high heat.  Brush bok choy and peppers with 2 Tbsp. of the remaining dressing.  Grill bok choy 1 min. or until slightly wilted and peppers 4 min. or until crisp-tender, turning occasionally.  Remove from grill; set aside.                                             Remove chicken from marinade; discard marinade. Grill chicken 3 to 4 min. on each side or until done (165F), turning occasionally.                                            Trim core from bok choy; discard. Chop remaining bok choy into bite-size pieces.  Cut red pepper into small chunks and chicken into thin strips. Arrange bok choy, peppers, chicken, pea pods and carrots in rows on plate; top with nuts and remaining dressing.

steps.step: Pour 1/4 cup dressing over chicken in shallow dish; turn to coat both sides of each breast.  Refrigerate 30 min. to marinate.
Heat greased grill to medium-high heat.
Brush bok choy and peppers with 2 Tbsp. of the remaining dressing.  Grill bok choy 1 min. or until slightly wilted and peppers 4 min. or until crisp-tender, turning occasionally.
Remove chicken from marinade; discard marinade. Grill chicken 3 to 4 min. on each side or until done (165F), turning occasionally.
Trim core from bok choy; discard. Chop remaining bok choy into bite-size pieces.
Cut red pepper into small chunks and chicken into thin strips. Arrange bok choy, peppers, chicken, pea pods and carrots in rows on plate; top with nuts and remaining dressing.
